cards.name: Rapid Decay
cards.text:
Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The grave robbers arrived the day after the burial. They were a day too late.

rulings.text: You pick the cards during announcement. If any are not there on resolution, any others that are there are still affected.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}
Remove from the game up to three target cards in a single graveyard.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"For all the priceless tomes they have destroyed, one would think they would taste better."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play, target opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Scent of Nightshade
cards.text: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby the value of X, on resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Skittering Horror
cards.text: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.
cards.flavor:
"This monstrosity will do—for now."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

rulings.text: Triggers when you announce a creature spell, and will resolve before that creature is put onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When you play a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.

cards.name: Slinking Skirge
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Sacrifice Slinking Skirge: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Davvol encouraged the skirges; they made excellent sentries and were quite edible if properly seasoned.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Sacrifice Slinking Skirge: Draw a card.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: As no one has ever accepted a second invitation to Davvol's table, the evincar often dines alone.
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Squirming Mass
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.
cards.originalText: Squirming Mass can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.

cards.name: Twisted Experiment
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.
cards.flavor: Gatha showed remarkable prowess in increasing his subjects' stature. Their lifespans, however, were another matter.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +3/-1.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Bargain
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: He craves only one commodity.
cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Aether Sting
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Aether Sting deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: When Gatha fell, he was called to account for each abomination he created.

rulings.text: The ability triggers when an opponent casts a creature spell, and goes on the stack above that spell. As such, the ability will deal 1 damage to that player before the creature enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents plays a creature spell, Æther Sting deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
cards.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.

cards.name: Cinder Seer
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Cinder Seer deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards and deal zero damage.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, {T}: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Cinder Seer deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Colos Yearling
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
{R}: Colos Yearling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A steed grows with its rider.
cards.originalText:
Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a mountain.)
{R}: Colos Yearling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Covetous Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.
cards.flavor: Gatha survived as long as he did by giving all Keld's predators exactly what they wanted.

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control an artifact, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
The ability only checks if you control no artifacts at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution. So gaining control of an artifact before then will not save the Dragon.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When you control no artifacts, sacrifice Covetous Dragon.

cards.name: Flame Jet
cards.text:
Flame Jet deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Did the land make the Keldons? Did the Keldons make the land? Or were they simply meant for each other?

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}
Flame Jet deals 3 damage to target player.

cards.name: Goblin Berserker
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor: Goblins don't know the meaning of the word "tactics"—or the word "meaning," for that matter.
cards.originalText: First strike; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Goblin Festival
cards.text: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to any target. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.
cards.flavor: "What are we celebratin' again?"

rulings.text: If you activate this multiple times in a row so the stack has more than one of this ability on it, the abilities will still resolve even if Goblin Festival leaves the battlefield or leaves your control before they resolve. For example, if activate the ability twice, and after the first flip you lose control of it because you lost the toss, or it leaves the battlefield, then you still flip for the second ability.

The controller of the ability chooses one of their opponents. If this card changes controllers before the ability resolves, you still pick an opponent of the player who controlled it when it was activated.

cards.originalText: {2}: Goblin Festival deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, choose one of your opponents. That player gains control of Goblin Festival.

cards.name: Goblin Gardener
cards.text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: "Grow food in dirt? Save time—eat dirt."

rulings.text: The ability is not optional. You have to choose one of your own lands if your opponent has none.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Gardener is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target land.

cards.name: Goblin Marshal
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Goblin Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.originalText:
Echo
Whenever Goblin Marshal comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Goblin Masons
cards.text: When Goblin Masons dies, destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor: "Goblins build with true zeal—and anything else within arm's reach."

rulings.text: If there is no Wall to target, then the ability just gets removed from the stack before any player gets priority.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Masons is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Hulking Ogre
cards.text: Hulking Ogre can't block.
cards.flavor:
"The Keldons' ogre campaign provided more body parts than my meager facility could properly use."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade
cards.originalText: Hulking Ogre can't block.

cards.name: Impatience
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Ask a Keldon to hold his temper and you'll be left holding your guts.

rulings.text: If a spell is countered, it still counts as having been cast.

cards.originalText: At the end of each player's turn, if that player didn't play a spell that turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Incendiary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Incendiary.
When enchanted creature dies, Incendiary deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of fuse counters on Incendiary.

rulings.text: Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Incendiary.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, Incendiary deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of fuse counters on Incendiary.

cards.name: Keldon Champion
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Keldon Champion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.originalText:
Echo; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
When Keldon Champion comes into play, it deals 3 damage to target player.

cards.name: Keldon Vandals
cards.text:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Keldon Vandals enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Keldons divide all their spoils into two groups: trophies and catapult ammunition.
cards.originalText:
Echo
When Keldon Vandals comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Landslide
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of Mountains. Landslide deals that much damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor:
Sometimes the mountain takes.
—Keldon saying

rulings.text: You can sacrifice zero mountains to deal zero damage.
You sacrifice the mountains during resolution.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice any number of mountains. Landslide deals that much damage to target player.

cards.name: Mark of Fury
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
At the beginning of the end step, return Mark of Fury to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Many Keldon warriors bear the mark of intentional insanity.

rulings.text: It only returns if it is still on the battlefield at end of turn.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gains haste. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.) 
At end of turn, return Mark of Fury to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Reckless Abandon
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The climax of a warlord's career is always death.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Reckless Abandon, sacrifice a creature.
Reckless Abandon deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Repercussion
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, Repercussion deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: Not all Keld's warriors are found on the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, Repercussion deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Scent of Cinder
cards.text: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Scent of Cinder deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby set the value of X, on resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of red cards in your hand. Scent of Cinder deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Sowing Salt
cards.text: Exile target nonbasic land. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that land and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Remove target nonbasic land from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack, but when to stop.

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.
Even though Trumpet Blast affects only attacking creatures, the bonus will remain for the rest of the turn.
Only creatures that are attacking as Trumpet Blast resolves will receive the bonus. In other words, casting it before you've declared attackers usually won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wake of Destruction
cards.text: Destroy target land and all other lands with the same name as that land.
cards.flavor:
Land charred black, rivers boiled,
Crops and wells alike despoiled,
Mountains leveled, forests felled—
Footprints of the beasts of Keld.

rulings.text: Only looks at the card name, so it will not destroy lands that just share the destroyed land's type.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land and all lands with the same name as that land.

cards.name: Wild Colos
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor: You'll never get a Keldon's goat.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback.

cards.name: Compost
cards.text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

rulings.text: The ability triggers on a black card being discarded, milled, or countered, as well as a black card going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever a black card is put into one of your opponents' graveyards, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Elvish Lookout
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Like a masterful quilter, Yavimaya stitches together patches of color to warn its denizens of threats.
cards.originalText: Elvish Lookout can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

rulings.text: Emperor Crocodile's ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even if it's only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).
The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

cards.originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Gamekeeper
cards.text: When Gamekeeper dies, you may exile it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card onto the battlefield and put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

rulings.text: If you have no creature cards in your library, all the cards from your library end up in your graveyard and you do not get to put a creature onto the battlefield.
Exiling this card is optional.

cards.originalText: When Gamekeeper is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Gamekeeper from the game. If you do, reveal cards from your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into play and put the other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

cards.name: Goliath Beetle
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: The balance of nature dictates that one day humans will be stepped on by bugs.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Heart Warden
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{2}, Sacrifice Heart Warden: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"In Llanowar, we tend the forest's boughs and branches. In Yavimaya, we are a part of them."
—Rofellos of Llanowar
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.
{2}, Sacrifice Heart Warden: Draw a card.

cards.name: Hunting Moa
cards.text:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Hunting Moa enters the battlefield or dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: You get a +1/+1 counter both when it enters the battlefield and when it goes to a graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Echo
Whenever Hunting Moa comes into play or is put into a graveyard from play, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Ivy Seer
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards and give +0/+0.

cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Magnify
cards.text: All creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The seed torches' pollen gives off light, but the elves find it heightens their senses as well.
cards.originalText: All creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Marker Beetles
cards.text:
When Marker Beetles dies, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Marker Beetles: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: In case of emergency, crush bug.
cards.originalText:
When Marker Beetles is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Marker Beetles: Draw a card.

cards.name: Momentum
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a growth counter on Momentum.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each growth counter on Momentum.

rulings.text: Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a growth counter on Momentum.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each growth counter on Momentum.

cards.name: Multani's Decree
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.
cards.flavor:
"This is my place of power. Nothing can take root here unless I allow it."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 2 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

cards.name: Pattern of Rebirth
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller may search their library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield. If that player does, they shuffle their library.

rulings.text: Searching for a creature card is optional.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a creature card and put that card into play. If that player does, he or she then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Plated Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Plated Spider may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Plow Under
cards.text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
cards.flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land. To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying

rulings.text: The owner decides the order the two lands are stacked there.

cards.originalText: Put two target lands on top of their owner's library.

cards.name: Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} for each Forest you control.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool for each forest you control.

cards.name: Rofellos's Gift
cards.text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Return an enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand for each card revealed this way.
cards.flavor:
"Rise, elf. We are both of Gaea, and thus we are equal."
—Multani, to Rofellos

rulings.text: You reveal and you choose cards during the resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Return an enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Scent of Ivy
cards.text: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby set the value of X, on resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of green cards in your hand. Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Splinter
cards.text: Exile target artifact. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that artifact and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Splinter can target and exile cards that aren't always artifacts, but are artifacts when Splinter is cast and resolves (such as an animated Stalking Stones). Splinter's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Remove target artifact from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Taunting Elf
cards.text: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.
cards.flavor: Much to Multani's chagrin, Rofellos gleefully tutored Yavimaya's elves on the rudest and most vulgar words spoken in Llanowar.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Taunting Elf do so.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: Thorn Elemental may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Yavimaya Elder
cards.text:
When Yavimaya Elder dies, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
When Yavimaya Elder is put into a graveyard from play, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: From each seed, a world. From each world, a thousand seeds.
cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.

cards.name: Braidwood Cup
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I think it no accident that every civilized people has discovered the art of distillation."
—Rofellos of Llanowar
cards.originalText: {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Braidwood Sextant
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Braidwood Sextant: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Brass Secretary
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The students disliked the secretary for its unfailing memory—until they discovered it couldn't dodge thrown objects.
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice Brass Secretary: Draw a card.

cards.name: Caltrops
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
cards.flavor: Toward the end, Gatha struggled to keep his experiments in and his patrons out.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.

cards.name: Extruder
cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: As the invasion drew closer, Urza's means began to resemble Phyrexia's end.

rulings.text: It can choose itself as the target, but it won't resolve when it tries to resolve since it will no longer be on the battlefield. This is useful only when you want to simply destroy this card.

cards.originalText:
Echo
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Fodder Cannon
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Junk Diver
cards.text:
Flying
When Junk Diver dies, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Garbage in, treasure out.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Junk Diver is put into a graveyard from play, return another target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Mantis Engine
cards.text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: Tawnos left a legacy of animal designs in many of Urza's creations.
cards.originalText:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn.
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Masticore
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Masticore unless you discard a card.
{2}: Masticore deals 1 damage to target creature.
{2}: Regenerate Masticore.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose and discard a card from your hand. If you don't, sacrifice Masticore.
{2}: Masticore deals 1 damage to target creature.
{2}: Regenerate Masticore.

cards.name: Metalworker
cards.text: {T}: Reveal any number of artifact cards in your hand. Add {C}{C} for each card revealed this way.
cards.flavor:
"At this rate I fully expect to be replaced by a clockwork golem by year's end."
—Barrin

rulings.text: This is a mana ability. It does not go on the stack and can't be responded to.
You can reveal zero cards to gain zero mana.

cards.originalText: {T}: Reveal any number of artifact cards in your hand. Add two colorless mana to your mana pool for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Powder Keg
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

rulings.text: Only destroys artifacts and creatures with exactly the specified cost. It does not mean "less than or equal to".
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Powder Keg.
{T}, Sacrifice Powder Keg: Destroy each artifact and creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of fuse counters on Powder Keg.

cards.name: Scrying Glass
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals their hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

rulings.text: The only valid colors are white, black, blue, red, and green.
You choose a target opponent on announcement. You choose a number and color during resolution, then the targeted opponent reveals their hand.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Choose a number greater than 0 and a color. Target opponent reveals his or her hand. If that opponent reveals exactly the chosen number of cards of the chosen color, you draw a card.

cards.name: Storage Matrix
cards.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during their untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

rulings.text: This card's ability does not override effects which prevent a permanent from untapping.
Permanents with multiple types untap if any of their types is chosen. For example, an artifact creature untaps if either artifact or creature is chosen.

If another effect limits the number of permanents that untap, that number combines with Storage Matrix's effect. For example, Imi Statue says "players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps." If both Imi Statue and an untapped Storage Matrix are on the battlefield, and you choose "artifact," only one artifact untaps.

cards.originalText: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, instead of each player untapping the permanents he or she controls during his or her untap step, that player chooses artifacts, creatures, or lands and untaps all permanents of the chosen type he or she controls.

cards.name: Thran Dynamo
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
cards.flavor: Urza's metathran children were conceived, birthed, and nurtured by an integrated system of machines.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Thran Foundry
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Exile Thran Foundry: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor:
"What we do not use up, we use again."
—Urza
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Remove Thran Foundry from the game: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Thran Golem
cards.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.
cards.flavor: Karn felt more secure about his value to Urza when he realized he didn't need regular trimming.
cards.originalText: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and gains flying, first strike, and trample.

cards.name: Urza's Incubator
cards.text:
As Urza's Incubator enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Stop thinking like an artificer, Urza, and start thinking like a father!"
—Rayne, Academy Chancellor

rulings.text: Multiple Incubators are cumulative.
You choose a creature type right as it enters the battlefield, before any continuous effects are applied or trigged abilities trigger.

cards.originalText:
When Urza's Incubator comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to play.

cards.name: Yavimaya Hollow
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: For all its traps and defenses, Yavimaya has its havens, too.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Amrou Scout
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The people of Amrou were scattered by war and driven into hiding. Scouts maintain the beacon fires that signal "return" and "home."
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Amrou Seekers
cards.text: Amrou Seekers can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.
cards.flavor: The paradise of Amrou Haven had become a field of cinders. Its people struggled to survive, hoping to see visions of its past in the strange storms that quickly passed.
cards.originalText: Amrou Seekers can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

cards.name: Angel's Grace
cards.text:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
You can't lose the game this turn and your opponents can't win the game this turn. Until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

rulings.text: The last sentence applies only if your life total is being reduced by damage. Other effects or costs (such as "lose 1 life" or "pay 1 life") can reduce your life total below 1 as normal.
You can't pay more life than you have.
If your life total goes below 1, being dealt damage will not increase it back up to 1.
After the effect wears off during the cleanup step, you'll lose the game if your total is 0 or less (or you have ten or more poison counters).

Angel's Grace doesn't prevent damage. It only changes the result of damage dealt to you. For example, a creature with lifelink that deals damage to you will still cause its controller to gain life, even if that damage would reduce your life total to less than 1.
Players still get priority while a card with split second is on the stack.
Split second doesn't prevent players from activating mana abilities.
Split second doesn't prevent triggered abilities from triggering. If one does, its controller puts it on the stack and chooses targets for it, if any. Those abilities will resolve as normal.
Split second doesn't prevent players from performing special actions. Notably, players may turn face-down creatures face up while a spell with split second is on the stack.
Casting a spell with split second won't affect spells and abilities that are already on the stack.
If the resolution of a triggered ability involves casting a spell, that spell can't be cast if a spell with split second is on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't play spells or activated abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
You can't lose the game this turn and your opponents can't win the game this turn. Until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

cards.name: Benalish Cavalry
cards.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "My people swore to protect Benalia to the end. It is battered, but yet stands, as do we."
cards.originalText: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Castle Raptors
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Castle Raptors is untapped, it gets +0/+2.
cards.flavor: "Each place we see is as ruined and lifeless as the last. So here we stay, because this ruin is ours."
cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as Castle Raptors is untapped, it gets +0/+2.

cards.name: Cavalry Master
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Other creatures you control with flanking have flanking. (Each instance of flanking triggers separately.)

rulings.text: Cavalry Master adds only one instance of flanking per creature, even if that creature already has multiple instances of flanking.

If a creature without flanking is given flanking by another effect, then this ability will grant a second instance. Similarly, if a creature loses flanking, then it won't get the Calvary Master instance either.

cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Other creatures you control with flanking have flanking. (Each instance of flanking triggers separately.)

cards.name: Celestial Crusader
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Flying
Other white creatures get +1/+1.

rulings.text: Players still get priority while a card with split second is on the stack.
Split second doesn't prevent players from activating mana abilities.
Split second doesn't prevent triggered abilities from triggering. If one does, its controller puts it on the stack and chooses targets for it, if any. Those abilities will resolve as normal.
Split second doesn't prevent players from performing special actions. Notably, players may turn face-down creatures face up while a spell with split second is on the stack.
Casting a spell with split second won't affect spells and abilities that are already on the stack.
If the resolution of a triggered ability involves casting a spell, that spell can't be cast if a spell with split second is on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)
Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't play spells or activated abilities that aren't mana abilities.)
Flying
Other white creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Children of Korlis
cards.text: Sacrifice Children of Korlis: You gain life equal to the life you've lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)
cards.flavor:
"We have a proud history of self-sacrifice. But it is easy, in these bleak times, to find one among us who is eager to die for any cause."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

rulings.text: If your life total drops to 0 or less, it's too late to use this ability before losing the game.

The life you gain is based on the total of all changes where your life total went down during the turn, not the net downward change. So if you lose 5 life, gain 3 life, and then lose 2 more life before activating this ability, the ability causes you gain 7 life, not 4.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Children of Korlis: You gain life equal to the life you've lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)

cards.name: Chronosavant
cards.text: {1}{W}: Return Chronosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped. You skip your next turn.
cards.flavor: "In my dreams, I hear the voices of my future selves who have died in times yet to come. I use that knowledge to avoid those dark futures and continue my search for peace."

rulings.text: If Chronosavant is in your graveyard, you can activate this ability multiple times in response to itself. The first one that resolves will return Chronosavant to the battlefield and make you skip your next turn. The others will just make you skip turns.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Return Chronosavant from your graveyard to play tapped. Skip your next turn.

cards.name: Cloudchaser Kestrel
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Kestrel enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Kestrel comes into play, destroy target enchantment.
{W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.

cards.name: D'Avenant Healer
cards.text:
{T}: D'Avenant Healer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: "One arrow keenly fired might prevent more battlefield wounds than I could treat."
cards.originalText:
{T}: D'Avenant Healer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Detainment Spell
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
{1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.
cards.flavor: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

rulings.text: Detainment Spell prevents mana abilities of the enchanted creature from being activated.
Morph isn't an activated ability, so Detainment Spell doesn't prevent face-down creatures from being able to turn face up.
Responding to a creature's activated ability being activated by moving Detainment Spell onto that creature won't affect the ability that was just activated.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be played.
{1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.

cards.name: Divine Congregation
cards.text:
You gain 2 life for each creature target player controls.
Suspend 5—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. Whether or not you could actually complete all steps in casting the card is irrelevant. For example, you can exile a card with suspend that has no mana cost or requires a target even if no legal targets are available at that time.
Exiling a card with suspend isn't casting that card. This action doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
If the spell requires any targets, those targets are chosen when the spell is finally cast, not when it's exiled.
If the first triggered ability of suspend (the one that removes time counters) is countered, no time counter is removed. The ability will trigger again during the card's owner's next upkeep.
When the last time counter is removed, the second triggered ability of suspend will trigger. It doesn't matter why the last time counter was removed or what effect removed it.
If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.
As the second triggered ability resolves, you must cast the card if able. Timing restrictions based on the card's type are ignored.
If you can't cast the card, perhaps because there are no legal targets available, it remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

If the spell has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those if able. However, if an additional cost includes a mana payment, you are forced to pay that cost only if there's enough mana in your mana pool at the time you cast the spell. You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.
A creature cast using suspend will enter the battlefield with haste. It will have haste until another player gains control of it (or, in some rare cases, gains control of the creature spell itself).

cards.originalText:
You gain 2 life for each creature target player controls.
Suspend 5—{1}{W} (Rather than play this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and remove it from the game with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When you remove the last, play it without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Duskrider Peregrine
cards.text:
Flying, protection from black
Suspend 3—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

rulings.text: You can exile a card in your hand using suspend any time you could cast that card. Consider its card type, any effect that affects when you could cast it (such as flash) and any other effects that could stop you from casting it (such as Meddling Mage's effect) to determine if and when you can do this. If the second triggered ability of suspend (the one that lets you cast the card) is countered, the card can't be cast. It remains exiled with no time counters on it, and it's no longer suspended.

You aren't forced to activate any mana abilities, although you may do so if you wish.

foreignNames.name: ダスクライダーの大隼

cards.originalText:
Flying, protection from black
Suspend 3—{1}{W} (Rather than play this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and remove it from the game with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When you remove the last, play it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

cards.name: Errant Doomsayers
cards.text: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.
cards.flavor: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."
cards.originalText: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.

cards.name: Evangelize
cards.text:
Buyback {2}{W}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W}{W} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice they control.

rulings.text: When you put the spell on the stack, you choose an opponent, then that opponent chooses the target. This is not a choice made on resolution.

The target of the spell is a creature the chosen opponent controls. As Evangelize resolves, if the target isn't a creature controlled by the chosen opponent, Evangelize won't resolve. If Evangelize's target is changed (via Shunt, for example), the new target must be a creature controlled by the chosen opponent.

cards.originalText:
Buyback {2}{W}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W}{W} as you play this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice that he or she controls.

cards.name: Flickering Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{W}: Exile Flickering Spirit, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: It disappears each time with the hope that it will not return to the same desolation it left behind.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, Flickering Spirit is exiled, then immediately returned to the battlefield. It returns as a "new" creature. Any counters, Auras, and so on are removed. Any spells or abilities targeting Flickering Spirit no longer target it.
If Flickering Spirit's ability is activated, any "as this enters the battlefield" choices for it are made by its owner, not its previous controller.
If a token copy of Flickering Spirit uses its activated ability, the token will not return to the battlefield, because of the rule that says tokens that leave the battlefield can't return.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}{W}: Remove Flickering Spirit from the game, then return it to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Foriysian Interceptor
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Defender
Foriysian Interceptor can block an additional creature each combat.
cards.flavor: A focal point for time rifts, Foriys contends simultaneously with foes both new and old.

rulings.text: The third ability normally lets Foriysian Interceptor block two creatures. If another effect also lets it block an additional creature, the effects are cumulative.
If an effect says Foriysian Interceptor can't block, then it can't block any creatures.

foreignNames.name: フォライアスの介入者

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)
Defender
Foriysian Interceptor can block an additional creature.

cards.name: Fortify
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Where metal is tainted and wood is scarce, we are best armed by faith."
—Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

rulings.text: You choose the mode as you cast Fortify, not as it resolves.
Creatures that come under your control after Fortify resolves won't get the chosen bonus.

cards.originalText: Choose one Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn; or creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gaze of Justice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, tap three untapped white creatures you control.
Exile target creature.
Flashback {5}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost and any additional costs. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: The additional cost must be paid if Gaze of Justice is cast with flashback.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Gaze of Justice, tap three untapped white creatures you control.
Remove target creature from the game.
Flashback {5}{W} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost and any additional costs. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Griffin Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
When enchanted creature dies, create a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying.

rulings.text: If Griffin Guide and the enchanted creature go to the graveyard at the same time, Griffin Guide's ability will trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, put a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Gustcloak Cavalier
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Gustcloak Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
Whenever Gustcloak Cavalier becomes blocked, you may untap Gustcloak Cavalier and remove it from combat.
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Gustcloak Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
Whenever Gustcloak Cavalier becomes blocked, you may untap Gustcloak Cavalier and remove it from combat.

cards.name: Icatian Crier
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Create two 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens.
cards.flavor: A thousand years removed from her home, her news of war had lost its context, but not its relevance.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Put two 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens into play.
